items.sentence: I think we should tell Tom we won't do that anymore.
It would be better not to do that while Tom is here.
How many times have I told you to fold your clothes?
Three-fourths of the people of this town don't vote.
Employees are prohibited from watching the Olympics.
People change. There's not much you can do about it.
The government collapsed after a vote in parliament.
The mother and daughter represented two generations.
Everybody knows that we don't know what we're doing.
By the time I got there, everybody had already left.
I don't want to know what you're thinking right now.
Tom drinks some wine, but never enough to get drunk.
I'm having a difficult time finding a place to live.
Tom has almost completely recovered from his injury.
Tom has been offered a job singing on a cruise ship.
Tom returned the books he'd borrowed to the library.
If the weather is good tomorrow, let's go on a hike.
Tom landed the helicopter near the wounded soldiers.
I think that Tom could manage to do that by himself.
I think that Tom could manage to do that on his own.
Tom was the first person to encourage me to do that.
Tom and Mary eloped and are now living in Australia.
When I found Tom, I could see that he'd been crying.
Tom was always ready to help anyone who needed help.
My neighbor always mows his lawn on Sunday mornings.
Tell me the truth, unless you think I can't take it.
Those who speak about happiness often have sad eyes.
Why is everyone being so nice to me all of a sudden?
Did I understand the gist of the question correctly?
I haven't been to work. I've stayed at home all day.
If you want to be free, destroy your television set.
Here's a list of things we need to do before Monday.
Tom stole Mary's lunch from the office refrigerator.
Some well-known scientists say that study is flawed.
Minds, like parachutes, work best when they're open.
Even though I had money, I wasn't allowed to buy it.
Tom can't speak French, but many of his friends can.
I'm not exactly sure why you think I should do that.
I thought you said that the meeting was next Monday.
Tom realized he wouldn't be able to change anything.
Once all the money's run out, we'll have to give up.
I don't know why Tom doesn't want to talk with Mary.
You're glad that that's going to happen, aren't you?

You're much heavier than you used to be, aren't you?
You're much thinner than you used to be, aren't you?
You're the one responsible for all this, aren't you?
You're the one who should be doing that, aren't you?
You're the only person that can do this, aren't you?
This isn't the first time Tom has made that mistake.
